questions.ask: Have you had any work experience?
questions.answer: Yes, I’ve worked as a frontend developer both as a freelancer and in a corporate environment. I started with a freelance project in the crypto sector for an international client, and later joined Pragma, one of the largest tech companies in Colombia, where I contributed to the development and maintenance of internal applications.
I'm a native Spanish speaker from Colombia. I currently have a B1 level of English and I'm actively working to reach an advanced C1 level.
You can reach me using the button in the top right corner, where you’ll find links to my email and social networks.

questions.ask: Do you have a professional degree?
questions.answer: Yes, I completed both the technical and technological degrees in Software Analysis and Development at SENA.

questions.ask: What do you enjoy about being a developer?
questions.answer: I enjoy building products that have a real impact. Seeing how my skills help solve problems, improve user experiences, or make processes more efficient is very rewarding. I’m driven by continuous growth and the ability to deliver value through code.

questions.ask: Have you worked as a freelancer?
questions.answer: Yes, I worked as a freelancer on a cryptocurrency-related project for an international client. It allowed me to work independently, understand business requirements, and deliver functional frontend solutions.
